meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of mites or ticks.
meanings.sent1: The acaroid creature scurried across the forest floor, leaving tiny footprints.
meanings.sent2: The acaroid pests infested the old barn, causing concern for the farmer.
meanings.sent3: The acaroid mites threw a tiny party under the moonlight, dancing to their own beat.
meanings.sent4: Her room was so messy, it looked like an acaroid nest of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The acaroid pattern on the leaf was so intricate, it seemed like a work of art.

meanings.definition: A substance derived from mites or ticks.
meanings.sent1: The acaroid was carefully extracted from the tiny mites for scientific research.
meanings.sent2: The acaroid found in the forest was believed to have medicinal properties.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimented with adding acaroid to the recipe, creating a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The acaroid essence filled the room, reminding her of the forest after rain.
meanings.sent5: The vial contained a potent acaroid extract, ready for use in the laboratory.
